page.title: 07Caerphilly Common Area
page.content: The block surveyed included Caerphilly Common. The main coverage was uncultivated heathland. There was also a large proportion of coniferous trees surrounding the disused quarry areas. It was very wet underfoot, due to swamp regions that had recently been drained. The majority of houses in the area were modern, but Cwmwbwb Lodge and Twyn-y-Gwaw Cottages, which were built in the nineteenth century, are still present. Although there was no indication of mining on our map, we were told by a local old man, that there was a coalmine present up to the nineteen twenties.
